alert.note: Alert for Elkhart; Kosciusko; Marshall; Noble; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 7:16AM EDT until July 23 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Elkhart County in north central Indiana... Noble County in northeastern Indiana... Northern Whitley County in northeastern Indiana... Kosciusko County in north central Indiana... Northeastern Marshall County in north central Indiana... * Until 800 AM EDT. * At 716 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Middlebury to near Bourbon, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Warsaw, Kendallville, Columbia City, Nappanee, Winona Lake, Bremen, Ligonier, Syracuse, Tri-lakes, Albion, Bourbon, Milford, Rome City, North Webster, Pierceton, Etna, Wolcottville, Etna Green, Leesburg and Cromwell. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
